item.title: Alzheimer's preventative drug hope - BBC News
item.description:
Alzheimer's preventative drug hope - BBC News

Scientists have detected a number of drugs which could help protect against Alzheimer's disease, acting like statins for the brain. In experiments on worms, University of Cambridge researchers identified drugs which prevented the very first step towards brain cell death. They now want to match up drugs with specific stages of the disease.

item.title: Zika virus pregnancy case confirmed in Spain - first in Europe - BBC News
item.description:
Zika virus pregnancy case confirmed in Spain - first in Europe - BBC News

Spain has confirmed that a pregnant woman has been diagnosed with the Zika virus - the first such case in Europe. The health ministry said the woman had recently returned from Colombia, where it is believed she was infected. Zika, which is spreading through the Americas, has been linked to babies being born with underdeveloped brains.

item.title: Coldplay's seventh album tops chart after Super Bowl - BBC News
item.description:
Coldplay's seventh album tops chart after Super Bowl - BBC News

From the section Entertainment & Arts Coldplay have leapt to the top of the UK album chart after their Super Bowl performance on Sunday A Head Full Of Dreams had previously only peaked at number two - held off by Adele at the end of last year.

item.title: Match4Zara: Social media boosts cell donor search - BBC News
item.description:
Match4Zara: Social media boosts cell donor search - BBC News

The family of a 13-year-old girl urgently seeking a blood stem cell donor are "amazed" by the response they have received on social media. Zara Al Shaikh, who has acute myeloid leukaemia, opened a Twitter account with her father to appeal for help. Her second tweet has been shared more than 8,000 times.

item.title: Stephen Fry quits Twitter, saying 'fun is over' after Bafta spat - BBC News
item.description:
Stephen Fry quits Twitter, saying 'fun is over' after Bafta spat - BBC News

From the section Entertainment & Arts Bafta show host Stephen Fry has confirmed he has left Twitter declaring "the fun is over". He faced criticism online after comparing costume designer Jenny Beavan to a "bag lady" when she picked up her Bafta for Mad Max: Fury Road.

item.title: John Paul letters reveal 'intense' friendship with woman - BBC News
item.description:
John Paul letters reveal 'intense' friendship with woman - BBC News

Hundreds of letters and photographs that tell the story of Pope John Paul II's close relationship with a married woman, which lasted more than 30 years, have been shown to the BBC. The letters to Polish-born American philosopher Anna-Teresa Tymieniecka had been kept away from public view in the National Library of Poland for years.
